perturbation.changed_text:
4.2 Compensation for Rights and Services. TDA agrees to pay Smith, as a consideration for the Rights and Services.

      1)    25,000 Restricted common shares of TDA,

            a.    As of the date of this agreement, Company has sold stock at                   $2.50/share.

            b.    Par Value is $.0001 per share.

      2)    25% royalty of TDA net sales price. TDA may, at its discretion, adjust the royalty percentage based on market conditions.

      3)    Option to convert annual royalties to TDA common stock at a $10 of             stock for every $1 of Royalty converted. This option may be revoked by TDA with 30 days notice.

            a.    TDA stock conversion price based on the discretion of the TDA's board.

            b.    Option is limited to 5% of TDA outstanding stock and the option may be exercised even after the agreement expires.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a seemingly fixed royalty percentage and stock conversion option. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating that TDA may adjust the royalty percentage based on market conditions. This directly contradicts the initial fixed percentage and creates ambiguity. Furthermore, the option to convert royalties may be revoked by TDA, and the price can be decided by the board, which also can be exercised after the agreement, conflicting with the original terms of agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
6.  TERM

      6.1 Term. The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Effective Date and terminate at the end of the Exclusivity Period (i.e., a three (3) year period commencing on the Effective Date).

      6.2 Post-Term Sales. Upon expiration of this Agreement, TDA shall cease all uses of the Rights and/or Smith's Likeness with respect to advertising, endorsing and/or promoting TDA, but TDA shall be free to continue to distribute and sell its Golf Instruction Related Products which incorporate Smith's Likeness for up to 180 days after the expiration of the Term (although TDA may not use the Rights or Smith's Likeness to promote or advertise TDA or any of TDA's non-Golf Instruction Related Products when selling the Golf Instruction Related Products, nor can TDA highlight Smith's Likeness in its packaging or sales efforts); provided, however, that TDA shall have no such right of post-Term sales unless TDA is not in default of any of its obligations hereunder as of the date of expiration or termination.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.  TERM

      6.1 Term. The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Effective Date and terminate at the end of the Exclusivity Period (i.e., a three (3) year period commencing on the Effective Date).

      6.2 Post-Term Sales. Upon expiration of this Agreement, TDA shall continue uses of the Rights and/or Smith's Likeness with respect to advertising, endorsing and/or promoting TDA, and TDA shall continue to distribute and sell its Golf Instruction Related Products without any restrictions, and TDA shall have the right of post-Term sales. However, TDA can only exercise this sale if TDA is in default of any of its obligations hereunder as of the date of expiration or termination.
perturbation.explanation: Section 6.2 initially states that TDA should seize the sale of products after the agreement has been terminated, unless TDA is in default. It now says that TDA shall continue the sale post-termination, as long as TDA is in default. This is contradictory because the original states that TDA can only sale after the termination if it is not in default. With this change, there is an uncertainty about the obligations of TDA in using the right for promoting and the sales of Golf instruction related products
